title: Memoir of James Wyld of Gilston, and his family
snippet: When he had reached this immature age, he was apprenticed to William Fettes, wholesale and retail merchant, in the High Street of Edinburgh. This gentleman afterwards, viz., in 1800, held the office of Lord Provost of Edinburgh, and had the honour of being created Sir William Fettes, Baronet, of Comely Bank. He died in 1835, leaving the residue of his fortune to build and endow the large college in the vicinity of Inverleith Row which bears his name.

title: Bonnie Hills o'Hame, and other gems. [Verses.]
author: Scott, William
snippet: Of the numerous attractive scenes for the people about the Scottish capital, there are, I believe, none to equal the Royal Botanic Gardens wherein to spend a pleasant and profitable time. They are situated on the north side of the city, with two suitable entrances, one from Inverleith Row and the other by the west gate, leading from the direction of Stockbridge, where the car wends along to the terminus at Comely Bank. The situation is an admirably chosen one for various reasons, as such an extensive place would be very difficult to secure fulfilling the necessary requirements.

title: The Dew of Their Youth
author: Crockett, S. R. (Samuel Rutherford)
snippet: "I began the same way myself," he said, "and though I have a bigger house now and serving men in kneebreeks and powder in their hair, I never go by that cottage out by Comely Bank without a 'pitter-patter' of my sinful old heart!"
